p: Cell entry is an essential component of cross-species transmission, especially for the β-CoVs. All CoVs encode a surface glycoprotein, spike, which binds to the host receptor and mediates viral entry [ 111]. For β-CoVs, the RBD of the spike protein mediates the interaction with host receptor. Upon binding the receptor, the spike protein is cleaved by nearby host proteases and releases the signal peptide to facilitate virus entry into host cells [ [112], [113], [114], [115]].
